business.headline: India's Q2 GDP slows to 5.4%, hits 18-month low on weak consumptionThe weaker-than-expected GDP growth raises concerns about the sustainability of economic recovery, particularly as key sectors like manufacturing and mining face challenges.

Sensex, Nifty end higher as heavyweight stocks gain; Q2 GDP data in focusThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 759.05 points to 79,802.79 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 216.95 points to 24,131.10. Both the indices had declined roughly 1.5% yesterday.

Enviro Infra shares make strong debut, list at 49% premium over IPO priceEnviro Infra Engineers listing: The shares opened at Rs 220 on the NSE, marking a 48.64% jump from the IPO price of Rs 148. On the BSE, the stock listed at Rs 218, reflecting a 47.29% premium.

Adani group stocks extend winning streak, rally up to 12% todayAdani Group stocks such as Adani Green Energy Ltd, Adani Power Ltd, Adani Energy Solutions Ltd, and Adani Enterprises Ltd gained as much as 12% after the recent clarification on the US bribery charges.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Devendra Fadnavis finalised as Chief Minister, claims senior BJP leader: ReportCaretaker Chief Minister Eknath Shinde has said that he would fully support the decision taken by PM Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah with regard to the chief minister's name.
Seven feared trapped under mudslide caused by Cyclone Fengal in TiruvannamalaiThe mudslide, triggered by the torrential downpours from Cyclone Fengal, has engulfed three houses in the area.

'No difference between India and Bangladesh': Mehbooba Mufti's remark sparks rowThe PDP chief said that if Bangladesh committed atrocities against its minorities, and if India did the same, how could India be different from Bangladesh?

Passengers stranded in Kuwait for 13 hours, Embassy clarifies visa rule for IndiansThe Indian Embassy in Kuwait said that it had taken up the matter immediately with Gulf Air, and a team from the embassy was present at the airport to assist the passengers.

10-year-old Indian-British boy outranks Albert Einstein, Stephen Hawking in IQKrish Arora, a 10-year-old from Hounslow, London, has gained recognition for achieving an IQ score of 162, surpassing Einstein and Hawking's estimated IQs. Accepted into Mensa, he's also a gifted pianist with a grade 7 certificate and excels in chess.

2 Indian-origin Canadians arrested in $40 million cocaine bust in USIllinois State Police seized over $40 million worth of cocaine from a semi-trailer near the Iowa state line, arresting two Indian-origin Canadians.

Schools closed in 2 Tamil Nadu districts today as Cyclone Fengal crosses stateCyclone Fengal Tracker Live Updates: Cyclone Fengal, pronounced "Feinjal", made landfall along the Tamil Nadu-Puducherry coast between Karaikal and Mahabalipuram near Puducherry on Saturday evening, with wind speeds of 70-80 kmph, gusting to 90 kmph, according to the IMD. Heavy rainfall lashed several parts of north Tamil Nadu, including Chennai, and Puducherry as a red alert was issued in Chennai, Tiruvallur, Kancheepuram, Kallakurichi, and Cuddalore districts, as well as Puducherry. Coastal areas are experiencing high tides and worsening weather. Schools and colleges remain closed, and the NDRF and state disaster teams have been deployed in vulnerable districts. Stay with Indiatoday.in for all the latest updates.

This is nuts: Vivek Ramaswamy on New York's $220-million deal with Pak-owned hotelRamaswamy made the remark on X reposting New York-based author John LeFevre's post, in which he claimed that the deal with the Pakistan government was part of a recent IMF bailout package.

India's love for golu-molu kids is feeding an epidemicMost Indians instinctively pull the cheeks of chubby babies. India's love for "golu-molu" kids is adding to the obesity epidemic. This is what's at the root of the love for overweight kids and how it is resulting in pre-onset diabetes and hypertension in teenagers.

As Trump threatens 100% tariffs, where India stands on Brics currency vs dollarAs Donald Trump threatened 100% tariffs on Brics nations, including India, if a new Brics currency was developed to replace the US dollar, India adopted a cautious approach to de-dollarisation even as Washington recently became New Delhi's leading trading partner.

What father Eknath saidEknath Shinde addressed speculation about his son, Shrikant Shinde, being considered for Deputy Chief Minister, saying discussions with senior leaders, including Amit Shah, were ongoing and no final decision had been made.

FIR against 'EVM hacker' Syed Shuja after poll panel rejects tampering claimsThe Maharashtra Cyber Police have filed an FIR against Syed Shuja, following a complaint from the state's Chief Electoral Officer (CEO). education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.
